013package org.apache.juneau.svl;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.StringUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
018
019import java.io.*;
020import java.lang.reflect.*;
021import java.util.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
026
027/**
028 * A var resolver session that combines a {@link VarResolver} with one or more session objects.
029 *
030 * <p>
031 * Instances of this class are considered light-weight and fast to construct, use, and discard.
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * This class contains the workhorse code for var resolution.
035 *
036 * <p>
037 * Instances of this class are created through the {@link VarResolver#createSession()} and
038 * {@link VarResolver#createSession(BeanStore)} methods.
039 *
040 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
041 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not guaranteed to be thread safe.
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
045 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/SimpleVariableLanguageBasics">Simple Variable Language Basics</a>
046 * </ul>
047 */
048public class VarResolverSession {
049
050   private final VarResolver context;
051   private final BeanStore beanStore;
052
053   /**
054    * Constructor.
055    *
056    * @param context
057    *    The {@link VarResolver} context object that contains the {@link Var Vars} and context objects associated with
058    *    that resolver.
059    * @param beanStore The bean store to use for resolving beans needed by vars.
060    *
061    */
062   public VarResolverSession(VarResolver context, BeanStore beanStore) {
063      this.context = context;
064      this.beanStore = BeanStore.of(beanStore);
065   }
066
067   /**
068    * Resolve all variables in the specified string.
069    *
070    * @param s
071    *    The string to resolve variables in.
072    * @return
073    *    The new string with all variables resolved, or the same string if no variables were found.
074    *    <br>Returns <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
075    */
076   public String resolve(String s) {
077
078      if (s == null || s.isEmpty() || (s.indexOf('$') == -1 && s.indexOf('\\') == -1))
079         return s;
080
081      // Special case where value consists of a single variable with no embedded variables (e.g. "$X{...}").
082      // This is a common case, so we want an optimized solution that doesn't involve string builders.
083      if (isSimpleVar(s)) {
084         String var = s.substring(1, s.indexOf('{'));
085         String val = s.substring(s.indexOf('{')+1, s.length()-1);
086         Var v = getVar(var);
087         if (v != null) {
088            try {
089               if (v.streamed) {
090                  StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
091                  v.resolveTo(this, sw, val);
092                  return sw.toString();
093               }
094               s = v.doResolve(this, val);
095               if (s == null)
096                  s = "";
097               return (v.allowRecurse() ? resolve(s) : s);
098            } catch (VarResolverException e) {
099               throw e;
100            } catch (Exception e) {
101               throw new VarResolverException(e, "Problem occurred resolving variable ''{0}'' in string ''{1}''", var, s);
102            }
103         }
104         return s;
105      }
106
107      try {
108         return resolveTo(s, new StringWriter()).toString();
109      } catch (IOException e) {
110         throw asRuntimeException(e); // Never happens.
111      }
112   }
113
114   /**
115    * Convenience method for resolving variables in arbitrary objects.
116    *
117    * <p>
118    * Supports resolving variables in the following object types:
119    * <ul>
120    *    <li>{@link CharSequence}
121    *    <li>Arrays containing values of type {@link CharSequence}.
122    *    <li>Collections containing values of type {@link CharSequence}.
123    *       <br>Collection class must have a no-arg constructor.
124    *    <li>Maps containing values of type {@link CharSequence}.
125    *       <br>Map class must have a no-arg constructor.
126    * </ul>
127    *
128    * @param <T> The value type.
129    * @param o The object.
130    * @return The same object if no resolution was needed, otherwise a new object or data structure if resolution was
131    * needed.
132    */
133   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
134   public <T> T resolve(T o) {
135      if (o == null)
136         return null;
137      if (o instanceof CharSequence)
138         return (T)resolve(o.toString());
139      if (isArray(o)) {
140         if (! containsVars(o))
141            return o;
142         Object o2 = Array.newInstance(o.getClass().getComponentType(), Array.getLength(o));
143         for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(o); i++)
144            Array.set(o2, i, resolve(Array.get(o, i)));
145         return (T)o2;
146      }
147      if (o instanceof Collection) {
148         try {
149            Collection c = (Collection)o;
150            if (! containsVars(c))
151               return o;
152            Collection c2 = c.getClass().getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
153            c.forEach(x -> c2.add(resolve(x)));
154            return (T)c2;
155         } catch (VarResolverException e) {
156            throw e;
157         } catch (Exception e) {
158            throw new VarResolverException(e, "Problem occurred resolving collection.");
159         }
160      }
161      if (o instanceof Map) {
162         try {
163            Map m = (Map)o;
164            if (! containsVars(m))
165               return o;
166            Map m2 = m.getClass().getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
167            m.forEach((k,v) -> m2.put(k, resolve(v)));
168            return (T)m2;
169         } catch (VarResolverException e) {
170            throw e;
171         } catch (Exception e) {
172            throw new VarResolverException(e, "Problem occurred resolving map.");
173         }
174      }
175      return o;
176   }
177
178   private static boolean containsVars(Object array) {
179      for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(array); i++) {
180         Object o = Array.get(array, i);
181         if (o instanceof CharSequence && o.toString().contains("$"))
182            return true;
183      }
184      return false;
185   }
186
187   private static boolean containsVars(Collection<?> c) {
188      Flag f = Flag.create();
189      c.forEach(x -> {
190         if (x instanceof CharSequence && x.toString().contains("$"))
191            f.set();
192      });
193      return f.isSet();
194   }
195
196   private static boolean containsVars(Map<?,?> m) {
197      Flag f = Flag.create();
198      m.forEach((k,v) -> {
199         if (v instanceof CharSequence && v.toString().contains("$"))
200            f.set();
201      });
202      return f.isSet();
203   }
204
205   /*
206    * Checks to see if string is of the simple form "$X{...}" with no embedded variables.
207    * This is a common case, and we can avoid using StringWriters.
208    */
209   private static boolean isSimpleVar(String s) {
210      int S1 = 1;    // Not in variable, looking for $
211      int S2 = 2;    // Found $, Looking for {
212      int S3 = 3;    // Found {, Looking for }
213      int S4 = 4;    // Found }
214
215      int length = s.length();
216      int state = S1;
217      for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
218         char c = s.charAt(i);
219         if (state == S1) {
220            if (c == '$') {
221               state = S2;
222            } else {
223               return false;
224            }
225         } else if (state == S2) {
226            if (c == '{') {
227               state = S3;
228            } else if (c < 'A' || c > 'z' || (c > 'Z' && c < 'a')) {   // False trigger "$X "
229               return false;
230            }
231         } else if (state == S3) {
232            if (c == '}')
233               state = S4;
234            else if (c == '{' || c == '$')
235               return false;
236         } else if (state == S4) {
237            return false;
238         }
239      }
240      return state == S4;
241   }
242
243   /**
244    * Resolves variables in the specified string and sends the output to the specified writer.
245    *
246    * <p>
247    * More efficient than first parsing to a string and then serializing to the writer since this method doesn't need
248    * to construct a large string.
249    *
250    * @param s The string to resolve variables in.
251    * @param out The writer to write to.
252    * @return The same writer.
253    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
254    */
255   public Writer resolveTo(String s, Writer out) throws IOException {
256
257      int S1 = 1;    // Not in variable, looking for $
258      int S2 = 2;    // Found $, Looking for {
259      int S3 = 3;    // Found {, Looking for }
260
261      int state = S1;
262      boolean isInEscape = false;
263      boolean hasInternalVar = false;
264      boolean hasInnerEscapes = false;
265      String varType = null;
266      String varVal = null;
267      int x = 0, x2 = 0;
268      int depth = 0;
269      int length = s.length();
270      for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
271         char c = s.charAt(i);
272         if (state == S1) {
273            if (isInEscape) {
274               if (c == '\\' || c == '$') {
275                  out.append(c);
276               } else {
277                  out.append('\\').append(c);
278               }
279               isInEscape = false;
280            } else if (c == '\\') {
281               isInEscape = true;
282            } else if (c == '$') {
283               x = i;
284               x2 = i;
285               state = S2;
286            } else {
287               out.append(c);
288            }
289         } else if (state == S2) {
290            if (isInEscape) {
291               isInEscape = false;
292            } else if (c == '\\') {
293               hasInnerEscapes = true;
294               isInEscape = true;
295            } else if (c == '{') {
296               varType = s.substring(x+1, i);
297               x = i;
298               state = S3;
299            } else if (c < 'A' || c > 'z' || (c > 'Z' && c < 'a')) {  // False trigger "$X "
300               if (hasInnerEscapes)
301                  out.append(unEscapeChars(s.substring(x, i+1), AS1));
302               else
303                  out.append(s, x, i+1);
304               x = i + 1;
305               state = S1;
306               hasInnerEscapes = false;
307            }
308         } else if (state == S3) {
309            if (isInEscape) {
310               isInEscape = false;
311            } else if (c == '\\') {
312               isInEscape = true;
313               hasInnerEscapes = true;
314            } else if (c == '{') {
315               depth++;
316               hasInternalVar = true;
317            } else if (c == '}') {
318               if (depth > 0) {
319                  depth--;
320               } else {
321                  varVal = s.substring(x+1, i);
322                  Var r = getVar(varType);
323                  if (r == null) {
324                     if (hasInnerEscapes)
325                        out.append(unEscapeChars(s.substring(x2, i+1), AS2));
326                     else
327                        out.append(s, x2, i+1);
328                     x = i+1;
329                  } else {
330                     varVal = (hasInternalVar && r.allowNested() ? resolve(varVal) : varVal);
331                     try {
332                        if (r.streamed)
333                           r.resolveTo(this, out, varVal);
334                        else {
335                           String replacement = r.doResolve(this, varVal);
336                           if (replacement == null)
337                              replacement = "";
338                           // If the replacement also contains variables, replace them now.
339                           if (replacement.indexOf('$') != -1 && r.allowRecurse())
340                              replacement = resolve(replacement);
341                           out.append(replacement);
342                        }
343                     } catch (VarResolverException e) {
344                        throw e;
345                     } catch (Exception e) {
346                        throw new VarResolverException(e, "Problem occurred resolving variable ''{0}'' in string ''{1}''", varType, s);
347                     }
348                     x = i+1;
349                  }
350                  state = 1;
351                  hasInnerEscapes = false;
352               }
353            }
354         }
355      }
356      if (isInEscape)
357         out.append('\\');
358      else if (state == S2)
359         out.append('$').append(unEscapeChars(s.substring(x+1), AS1));
360      else if (state == S3)
361         out.append('$').append(varType).append('{').append(unEscapeChars(s.substring(x+1), AS2));
362      return out;
363   }
364
365   private static final AsciiSet
366      AS1 = AsciiSet.of("\\{"),
367      AS2 = AsciiSet.of("\\${}")
368   ;
369
370   /**
371    * Returns the bean from the registered bean store.
372    *
373    * @param <T> The value type.
374    * @param c The bean type.
375    * @return
376    *    The bean.
377    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
378    */
379   public <T> Optional<T> getBean(Class<T> c) {
380      Optional<T> t = beanStore.getBean(c);
381      if (! t.isPresent())
382         t = context.beanStore.getBean(c);
383      return t;
384   }
385
386   /**
387    * Returns the {@link Var} with the specified name.
388    *
389    * @param name The var name (e.g. <js>"S"</js>).
390    * @return The {@link Var} instance, or <jk>null</jk> if no <c>Var</c> is associated with the specified name.
391    */
392   protected Var getVar(String name) {
393      Var v = this.context.getVarMap().get(name);
394      return v != null && v.canResolve(this) ? v : null;
395   }
396
397   /**
398    * Resolves the specified strings in the string array.
399    *
400    * @param in The string array containing variables to resolve.
401    * @return An array with resolved strings.
402    */
403   public String[] resolve(String[] in) {
404      String[] out = new String[in.length];
405      for (int i = 0; i < in.length; i++)
406         out[i] = resolve(in[i]);
407      return out;
408   }
409
410   /**
411    * Adds a bean to this session.
412    *
413    * @param <T> The bean type.
414    * @param c The bean type.
415    * @param value The bean.
416    * @return This object.
417    */
418   public <T> VarResolverSession bean(Class<T> c, T value) {
419      beanStore.addBean(c, value);
420      return this;
421   }
422
423   @Override /* Object */
424   public String toString() {
425      return "var=" + this.context.getVarMap().keySet() + ", context.beanStore=" + this.context.beanStore + ", session.beanStore=" + beanStore;
426   }
427}
